intro: [WRONG START] Hieracesium astraferens, commonly known as the star-hair hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads and opposite leaf arrangement. The plant features yellow flowers that bloom in late summer, and its leaves are typically lance-shaped with hairy surfaces. It thrives in meadows and grasslands, preferring moist, well-drained soils. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens, though it can be invasive in certain environments.
